text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I'm going to show

you how to make some delicious and easy - what
I like to call my pizza stuffed peppers, so

they're so, so good, such a good family, comforting
yummy dinner, and it's going to be using some

leftover stuffing that I've got so I'm thrilled
to share it with you because if you are somebody

that's going to be making traditional stuffing
for your Thanksgiving table or your holiday

table, then you can use the leftovers in this
recipe!

Make sure that your stuffing doesn't have
dried fruits and nuts and things like that

in it, I mean I guess you could just add it
to this but I just think that plain stuffing

tastes best, so let me run you through the
list of ingredients because it's really not
that big but they're all the right ones.

You need some ground beef, it's a really great
recipe to make ground beef really stretch

for a lot of people, this is my leftover stuffing,
it's crumbly it's cold and it's tasteless
so it's going to be perfect here!

Lots of chopped up pepperoni, I've got my
marinara sauce here, a little marinara sauce,

a pinch of dried oregano, lots of chopped
parsley, onion, garlic, an egg, I've got parmigiano,

bell peppers that I have cleaned, cut in half
and scooped out any seeds.

And you're also going to need some pizza cheese,
I like to use a combo of mozzarella and provolone,

some different brands make something called
'pizza cheese', 'pizza blend', so whatever
you want use that.

What I have here is a large casserole dish
that I have lined with a good amount of marinara

sauce, because this is going to be the flavor
base for everything.

So let's get started, super easy, you're going
to add pretty much everything in.

Your stuffing, your pepperoni, now the great
thing about this is that this makes a lot
of stuffed peppers.
It makes 8 halves.

Which I think one half is perfect per person,
because they're quite hearty, so it makes

a pound of ground beef go really far, so it's
a nice way to use a little bit of meat to

feed a lot of people, get your parsley, and
now what I'm going to do is I'm going to grate

my parmigiano and the onion and garlic right
in because I'm not going to be cooking ahead

of time, because I really think that if you
grate it it's just going to melt into the

cheese and the meat and as it cooks in the
oven it cooks all the way through, but if

you're going to just dice it then just give
them a stir with a little bit of olive oil

on the skillet and cook them up a little bit
before you add them here otherwise they retain
too much crunch.

But I'm just going to go ahead and grate this
with my microplane, and it's going to melt
in there and be delicious!

Alright, so I added everything in, grated
onion, grated garlic, the egg, the cheese,

I added a pinch of salt - everything's in
here, and now using a cook's best tool, clean
hands, go ahead and mix it all together.

And let me just tell you, you talk about flavor,
you talk about delicious home cooking, it
does not get much better than this!
I'm telling you!

And I call them pizza stuffed peppers because
of the pepperoni and the oregano and the cheese,

it does end up tasting like a pepperoni pizza
which is why I love it!

So, I'm just going to mix everything up really
well and then we're going to get going on
stuffing the peppers.

My peppers are all in and now I'm just going
to stuff them with my stuffing and look at

that we took Thanksgiving, Thanksgiving flavored
dressing - or some people call it dressing,
some people call it stuffing.

And we went ahead and made some Italian stuffed
peppers.

That's the thing you know, you really just
have to think a little bit out of the box

and I've said this before when it comes to
leftovers, I like my leftover turkey sandwich

the next day, with Brie, cranberry sauce,
I just need to have it, that's just my thing.

After that, I want nothing that tastes like
Thanksgiving food.

So I just take the leftovers and I make different
things with it that taste like a completely
different cuisine.

So I know a lot of other people are like that
as well, I know that a lot of people in my

family are like that so that's why I think
these kinds of recipes really come in handy.

Alright so I'm just going to stuff my peppers,
I'm almost done, and what I'm going to do

is I'm going to cover these with some aluminum
foil, I'm going to pop these into my oven

pre-heated at 350F and they're going to be
in there for about 45 minutes.

After the 45 minutes, because there's no point
in showing you this it would be a waste of

time, after the 45 minutes, I'm going to remove
the foil, top with cheese, pop them back in

for 15 minutes or so and I will show you what
they look like when they are complete and

they are going to be magnificent and I can't
wait to serve them with you.

So my peppers were in the oven for about 40
minutes, covered, and I took the foil off,

I put the cheese on and I slid them back in
without the foil for about 15 to 20 minutes

until the top was golden and the cheese was
bubbly, I just took these out about, I don't

know, a few minutes ago, so I'm going to give
myself one to try because if you could just

smell the aroma in here, you'd understand
why I'm not going to wait any longer.

I might risk really burning myself, but it
is a risk that mamma is willing to take!
Let me get in here, oh it smells so good!
Yum!
Yum!!
Yum!

I kind of deconstruct the whole thing when
I eat stuffed peppers.
My mouth is salivating!

It's going to be hot though, so I'm going
to need a minute.
Mmm!
Hot!
So, so so delicious!
My eyes are watering because it's so hot!

Full of flavor, definitely get that pizza
vibe with the pepperoni, and the oregano,

it's just fantastic, there's not a remnant
of Thanksgiving in here.

Even though my stuffing does contain celery,
onion, poultry seasoning, a little butter,

you don't get any of that, because that's
the point whenever I am using leftover classic

stuffing is to add it to things that are strong
enough to kind of hide all of those flavors.

Things like garlic and onions and sauce and
peppers, it kind of gets rid of all of those

flavors and becomes the dominant boss, because
that's what those flavors do.

So I hope that you give the leftover stuffing
a try by adding it to different things as

a binder, which I'm telling you is the best
thing to do with it and nobody will know,

and these peppers are worthy of being on your
family kitchen table, probably tonight, so

go to LauraintheKitchen.com, get the recipe,
I hope you have enjoyed spending time with
me and I'll see you next time.
Bye!
